discussion.title: Working with complex custom objectives
discussion.body:
How can I add and evaluate function to the objective ? 

Essentially, I want to also search for functions for polynomials in your example (_https://astroautomata.com/PySR/examples/#9-custom-objectives_). Something like this `f(P(X)) / g(Q(X))`, where `f = P(X) ** y` or something else. 

I tried to reserve first l and r nodes for these functions and use the rest for polynomials:
```
    tree.degree != 2 && return L(Inf)
   
    attraction_func = tree.l
    repultion_func= tree.r
    
    attraction_func != 2 && return L(Inf)
    repulsion_func != 2 && return L(Inf)
   
    attraction = attraction_func.l
    repulsion = repultion_func.l
```

but it gives `inf` loss and only complexity of 1

nodes.body:
Is this
```
attraction_func != 2
```
Supposed to be `attraction_func.degree != 2`?
